009package imagingbook.pub.geometry.lines;
010
011import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.isZero;
013
014import java.util.Locale;
015
016//import imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic;
017import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
018import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
019
020/**
021 * This class represents an algebraic line of the form a * x + b * y + c = 0.
022 * Instances are immutable and normalized such that ||(a,b)|| = 1.
023 * @author WB
024 *
025 */
026public class AlgebraicLine {
027        
028        private final double a, b, c;
029
030        // static factory methods ----------------------------------------
031        
032        public static AlgebraicLine fromPoints(Pnt2d p1, Pnt2d p2) {
033                double a = p1.getY() - p2.getY();
034                double b = p2.getX() - p1.getX();
035                double c = -a * p1.getX() - b * p1.getY();
036                return new AlgebraicLine(a, b, c);
037        }
038        
039        // constructors --------------------------------------------------
040
041        public AlgebraicLine(double a, double b, double c) {
042                double norm = Math.sqrt(sqr(a) + sqr(b));
043                if (isZero(norm)) {
044                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("a and b may not both be zero");
045                }
046                this.a = a / norm;
047                this.b = b / norm;
048                this.c = c / norm;
049        }
050        
051        public AlgebraicLine(AlgebraicLine L) {
052                this(L.a, L.b, L.c);
053        }
054        
055        // getter/setter methods ------------------------------------------
056        
057        public final double getA() {
058                return a;
059        }
060
061        public final double getB() {
062                return b;
063        }
064
065        public final double getC() {
066                return c;
067        }
068        
069        public double getXref() {
070                return 0.0;
071        }
072        
073        public double getYref() {
074                return 0.0;
075        }
076        
077        // other methods ------------------------------------------
078        
079        /**
080         * Returns the perpendicular distance between this line and the point (x, y).
081         * The result may be positive or negative, depending on which side of the line
082         * (x, y) is located. It is assumed that the line is normalized, i.e.,
083         * ||(a,b)|| = 1.
084         * 
085         * @param x x-coordinate of point position.
086         * @param y y-coordinate of point position.
087         * @return The perpendicular distance between this line and the point (x, y).
088         */
089        public double getDistance(double x, double y) {
090                return (a * (x - this.getXref()) + b * (y - this.getYref()) + c);
091        }
092        
093        /**
094         * Returns the perpendicular distance between this line and the point p. The
095         * result may be positive or negative, depending on which side of the line p is
096         * located.
097         * 
098         * @param p point position.
099         * @return The perpendicular distance between this line and the point p.
100         */
101        public double getDistance(Pnt2d p) {
102                return getDistance(p.getX(), p.getY());
103        }
104        
105        /**
106         * Returns the point on the line that is closest to the specified
107         * 2D point. The line is assumed to be normalized.
108         * 
109         * @param p an arbitrary 2D point
110         * @return the closest line point
111         */
112        public Pnt2d getClosestLinePoint(Pnt2d p) {
113                final double s = 1.0; // 1.0 / (sqr(a) + sqr(b)); // assumed to be normalized
114                final double xr = this.getXref();
115                final double yr = this.getYref();
116                double xx = p.getX() - xr;
117                double yy = p.getY() - yr;
118                double x0 = xr + s * (sqr(b) * xx - a * b * yy - a * c);
119                double y0 = yr + s * (sqr(a) * yy - a * b * xx - b * c);
120                return PntDouble.from(x0, y0);
121        }
122        
123//      @Override
124//      public Point getClosestLinePoint(Point p) {
125//              double s = 1.0; // 1.0 / (sqr(a) + sqr(b)); // assumed to be normalized
126//              double xx = p.getX() - xRef;
127//              double yy = p.getY() - yRef;
128//              double x0 = xRef + s * (sqr(b) * xx - a * b * yy - a * c);
129//              double y0 = yRef + s * (sqr(a) * yy - a * b * xx - b * c);
130//              return Point.create(x0, y0);
131//      }
132        
133//      /**
134//       * Returns the point on the line that is closest to the orgin.
135//       * This is equivalent to {@code getClosestLinePoint(Point.create(0, 0))}.
136//       * See also {@link #getClosestLinePoint(Point)}.
137//       * @return the closest line point
138//       */
139//      public Point getClosestLinePoint() {
140//              return getClosestLinePoint(Point.ZERO);
141//      }
142        
143        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
144        
145        @Override
146        public boolean equals(Object other) {
147                if (other instanceof AlgebraicLine) {
148                        AlgebraicLine L1 = this;
149                        AlgebraicLine L2 = (AlgebraicLine) other;
150                        double delta = 1E-6;
151                        // get two different points on L1:
152                        Pnt2d xA = L1.getClosestLinePoint(PntDouble.ZERO);
153                        Pnt2d xB = PntDouble.from(xA.getX() - L1.b, xA.getY() + L1.a);
154                        // check if both points are L2 too:
155                        return (isZero(L2.getDistance(xA), delta) && isZero(L2.getDistance(xB), delta));
156                }
157                else {
158                        return false;
159                }
160        }
161        
162        @Override
163        public String toString() {
164                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s <a = %.3f, b = %.3f, c = %.3f>",
165                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), a, b, c);
166        }
167        
168}
